alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 11:55AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheshire County through 1230 PM EDT... At 1155 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brattleboro, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Keene, Jaffrey, Winchester, Richmond, Gilsum, Marlborough, Hinsdale, Troy, Westmoreland, Swanzey, Chesterfield, Surry, Roxbury, Sullivan, Fitzwilliam and Walpole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
